area_name: Big Rock on the Hill, The

content.description:
The start is finicky; while there is a perfect ledge for both hands, feet are minimal/non-existent and big moves are required to progress into the route. I would say the route is composed of some dynamic pinches and crimps. The crux is between the start and progression along the rail. The route goes from the ledge to the rail above, traverse right and under the boulder detail up top, then top out.

Short and tension-y
content.protection: NA, bring a crash pad; several loose boulders around the base of the route, clearing is always appreciated.
content.location: The front is facing the trail. Fat ledge about 3 feet off the ground is the start, hard to miss. Most graffiti is on this face.

pathTokens: Big Rock on the Hill, The
